title: Guests Will Disclose the Private Project Full Activity Via Project Activity Feeds

profile.name: GitLab
profile.about: A single application for the entire software development lifecycle.

vulnerability_information:
Hello!

Here guests will disclose the complete activity of the project via feeds

##Reproduction Steps:

Create Private Project.

Invite Attacker as Guest.

Next attacker will go to https://gitlab.com/victimyoursz/helloproject/activity

and he access the feeds link

https://gitlab.com/victimyoursz/helloproject.atom?feed_token=FeRKF1AafTSJiLzJ5EyX


It Contains sensitive data i.e activity of the private project it can be disclosed by Guests.

###Here main thing is If guests distribute this links any unauthorized users can access this private project activity.


{F418246}

## Impact

Guests will disclose the private project activity via feeds.
vulnerability_information_html:
Hello!

Here guests will disclose the complete activity of the project via feeds

Reproduction Steps:

Create Private Project.

Invite Attacker as Guest.

Next attacker will go to https://gitlab.com/victimyoursz/helloproject/activity

and he access the feeds link

https://gitlab.com/victimyoursz/helloproject.atom?feed_token=FeRKF1AafTSJiLzJ5EyX

It Contains sensitive data i.e activity of the private project it can be disclosed by Guests.

Here main thing is If guests distribute this links any unauthorized users can access this private project activity.

Impact

Guests will disclose the private project activity via feeds.

activities.message:
Hi @urztruzchitrz,

There do not appear to be any security implications as a direct result of this behavior. The feed is protected by the `feed_token`.

Your effort is nonetheless appreciated and we wish that you'll continue to research and submit any future security issues you find. If you disagree, please reply with additional information describing your reasoning.

Kind regards,
@beagle

activities.message:
Hi @urztruzchitrz,

can you please provide more details which information the attacker can access via the activity feed that he should not be able to access? For example, can the attacker access information that he cannot access otherwise via GitLab's UI or API?

Since the attacker has been granted the guest role, it is expected that he has access to all information a guest should be able to access. Of course, the attacker can decide to publish this information and he does NOT rely on the activity feed for this (e.g. he could just publish his account credentials or screenshots etc.).

If you disagree, please provide a concrete example demonstrating how the activity feed leaks information that the attacker should not have access to.

Best regards,
Dennis
activities.markdown_message:

Of course, the attacker can decide to publish this information and he does NOT rely on the activity feed for this (e.g. he could just publish his account credentials or screenshots etc.).

If you disagree, please provide a concrete example demonstrating how the activity feed leaks information that the attacker should not have access to.

Best regards,
Dennis

activities.message:
@dappelt 

Thanks for your response!


###first of all why it is sensitive?

Here this links can disclose

Issues
merge requests
private project operations
repositories
etc.



you said 'can the attacker access information that he cannot access otherwise via GitLab's UI or API?'



Now let us say attacker will share project activity via this link https://gitlab.com/victimyoursz/helloproject/activity

When publicly opened then all others will see 404 not found page view the below image.


{F420159}

Now attacker i.e guest will go to his own account and go to https://gitlab.com/victimyoursz/helloproject/activity

and he will grab the project activity feed view the below image.


{F420160}

He will get this project feed link 


https://gitlab.com/victimyoursz/helloproject.atom?feed_token=FeRKF1AafTSJiLzJ5EyX



{F418246}

you said `Of course, the attacker can decide to publish this information and he does NOT rely on the activity feed for this (e.g. he could just publish his account credentials or screenshots etc.).`



Attacker i.e guest is only member of the project so it is contributing project so he is not sharing his own profile feed he is just sharing the private project feed which is complete activity.


###Is there any feature in gitlab presently we can share private project via links?

No there is no feature here attacker will disclose this links on social media any where and mainly any users can view this without any authentication.



###Why this is vulnerable?

Here the owner of the project will not blame any  one who is disclosing his private project weather guest or reporter.

Finally the attacker can disclose this links via email social media etc.

Finally attacker is not sharing his personal details but he is sharing the private project to others.

I hope this explanation clarifies.

Thanks!

activities.message:
Hi @urztruzchitrz,

thank you for the additional information.

Since it does not appear that the activity feed contains information to which the guest user should not have access according to our permission model (https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/permissions.html), I am closing this report. 

Note that publishing the activity feed is not a vulnerability, as long as the feed only contains information to which the guest user is intended to have access to. However, if you found that the activity feed contains information that the guest user should not have access to, please provide detailed steps on how to reproduce the issue.

Best regards,
Dennis
activities.markdown_message:

Note that publishing the activity feed is not a vulnerability, as long as the feed only contains information to which the guest user is intended to have access to. However, if you found that the activity feed contains information that the guest user should not have access to, please provide detailed steps on how to reproduce the issue.

Best regards,
Dennis

activities.message:
Thank you for the clarification.

If the guest user intends to leak information, he could indeed share the activity feed with the public. However, the guest user could as well reveal this information to the public by taking screenshots, copy & paste, publish his account credentials etc. What is important here is that the activity feed only contains information to which the guest user is intended to have access to according to our permission model https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/permissions.html

summaries.content: When the Project Activity Feeds disclosed by Guest Members or reporters or developers Any Unauthorized users can view the private project activity.
